definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
exam candidate/student whose name has been put forward for an exam

college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
to inspect/to observe and study/on-the-spot investigation
to examine/to check up on/to assess/to review/appraisal/review/evaluation
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to enter oneself for an examination
to pass a university entrance exam
entrance exam for senior middle school

sentences.english: It depends on which country you are planning to go.
sentences.chinese: 考哪种试是得依据外国粹校的请求的。

sentences.english: Why didn't you take TOEFL, IELTS or SAT tests?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么没有考雅思或是托福，赛达考试？

sentences.english: I don't advise you to go to Tsinghua.
The physical office environment is another reinforcer, says Armacost.
sentences.chinese: 办公室环境则是另外一帖增强剂，阿马考斯特说。

sentences.english: No questions. Caldwellhad made a living riding the consoles of the Union's capsule hotels.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔作出了生活乘坐控制台该联盟的胶囊酒店。

sentences.english: It will be my fifth time to take it.
sentences.chinese: 这将是我第五次考路考。

sentences.english: I blew it on that last exam.
The decline in breastfeeding has become a major concern to health workers.
sentences.chinese: 母乳哺喂率下降之关注议题已经考量到职场员工。

sentences.english: You are advised to keep a copy of this completed form for reference.
sentences.chinese: 阁下应保留一份填妥的投诉表格副本，以备參考。

sentences.english: The only reason high school students learn is to ace the test.
sentences.chinese: 高中生学习的唯一原因就是考优异成绩。

sentences.english: We congratulate her on having come first in her exams.
sentences.chinese: 我们祝贺他在每门考试中都考了第一。

sentences.english: Take an examination of legal couplet, to the personnel of legal major, better.
sentences.chinese: 考法律联考，对于法律专业的人员，比较好。

sentences.english: Tom is too hard-working not to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆这么用功，哪有考不及格的道理。

sentences.english: I wonder how he got his driver’s license.
sentences.chinese: 我怀疑他是怎么考到驾照的。

definition: college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
to enter oneself for an examination
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to add material to an exam/supplementary exam
